intro: Porroglossum rodrigoi, commonly known as the Rodrigues pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adaptations to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Porroglossum rodrigoi is a rare species, with limited distribution and facing threats from habitat degradation.
